thread.title: Expected Fed Inaction, PBOC Cut Lift Asian Bonds - WSJ
thread.title_full: Expected Fed Inaction, PBOC Cut Lift Asian Bonds - WSJ

author: Fiona Law
title: Expected Fed Inaction, PBOC Cut Lift Asian Bonds - WSJ
text: 0323 GMT [Dow Jones] Asian corporate bond prices are rising as traders expect the U.S. Federal Reserve to maintain interest rates at their meeting this week. The Chinese central bank’s move Friday to cut its benchmark interest rates and cut banks’ reserve-requirement ratio is also adding to a generally positive tone in markets, albeit on moderate turnover. “Clients are asking for offers here and there,” but price movements are not dramatic, said a senior trader at a European bank in Hong Kong. “We need to see a bit of new issuance to have a more exciting market,” the trader said.
